text: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. It has been a very rainy and windy spring in South Carolina. I am hoping it is not a prelude to what the summer will be like since I will be taking over the weekly lawn duties from Ed. He is getting his right shoulder replaced this week and will be out of commission for a while. A soggy lawn is not easy to cut. Ed showed me how to start and use all the controls on the riding tractor-style mower yesterday. I have only used the push mower in the past. Once I start cutting the grass I know I am going to feel like Mr. Douglas and start singing… “Green Acres is the place to be. Farm livin’ is the life for me. Land spreadin’ out so far and wide…” If you have no idea what I am referencing… you didn’t grow up in the late 1960’s – early 1970’s. :-) Anywho… Whatever you’re up to this week. I hope it’s wonderful. XO Now onto the links I found for you this week. Posts You May Have Missed This Week: Pretty New Drapes for my Daughter’s House (open in same tab) If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here. And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more. Post navigation
html:
Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online.

It has been a very rainy and windy spring in South Carolina. I am hoping it is not a prelude to what the summer will be like since I will be taking over the weekly lawn duties from Ed. He is getting his right shoulder replaced this week and will be out of commission for a while. A soggy lawn is not easy to cut.

Ed showed me how to start and use all the controls on the riding tractor-style mower yesterday. I have only used the push mower in the past. Once I start cutting the grass I know I am going to feel like Mr. Douglas and start singing… “Green Acres is the place to be. Farm livin’ is the life for me. Land spreadin’ out so far and wide…”

If you have no idea what I am referencing… you didn’t grow up in the late 1960’s – early 1970’s. :-)

Anywho… Whatever you’re up to this week. I hope it’s wonderful. XO

Now onto the links I found for you this week.

Posts You May Have Missed This Week:

  • Pretty New Drapes for my Daughter’s House (open in same tab)

If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here.

And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more.
